bug.author: kazunarikudo
bug.description:
Report from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rnamdos>@rnamdos</denchmark-link> . To Reproduce I get another error on the next line: <denchmark-code>In [11]: ia.start_acquisition() --------------------------------------------------------------------------- LogicalErrorException Traceback (most recent call last) ~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in __getattr__(self, attribute) 2079 try: -> 2080 return self.get_node(attribute) 2081 except LogicalErrorException as e:
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in get_node(self, key) 2031 def get_node(self, key): -> 2032 return _genapi.NodeMap_get_node(self, key) 2033
LogicalErrorException: Node not existing
The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-11-e1afb14284fb> in <module> ----> 1 ia.start_acquisition()
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/harvesters/core.py in start_acquisition(self, run_in_background) 2426 # We're ready to start image acquisition. Lock the device's 2427 # transport layer related features: -> 2428 self.remote_device.node_map.TLParamsLocked.value = 1 2429 except GenericException: 2430 # SFNC < 2.0
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in __getattr__(self, attribute) 2082 # Raise AttributeError to naturally work with 2083 # the hasattr function: -> 2084 raise AttributeError from e 2085 2086 def __setattr__(self, attribute, val):
AttributeError: </denchmark-code>
Expected behavior Harvester must handle legacy devices that do not support TLParamsLocked. Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS Python 3.6.10 :: Anaconda, Inc. Harvester: 1.2.8 GenTL Producer: mvIMPACT Acquire Camera: (id_='GE500C(dc:a5:01:34:d3:cd)', vendor='MindVision', model='GE500C', tl_type='GEV', user_defined_name=None, version='V3.2.92-3.1.80')
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rnamdos>@rnamdos</denchmark-link> Could you make another try with the latest version of the master branch, please?

Thanks for creating a new issue for this. I still get the same error. I cloned the repo git clone https://github.com/genicam/harvesters.git && cd harvesters && python setup.py install got this output (is this the latest?) Finished processing dependencies for harvesters==1.2.8.post0.dev1 ran in ipython and got same error <denchmark-code>In [10]: ia.start_acquisition() --------------------------------------------------------------------------- LogicalErrorException Traceback (most recent call last) ~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in __getattr__(self, attribute) 2079 try: -> 2080 return self.get_node(attribute) 2081 except LogicalErrorException as e:
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in get_node(self, key) 2031 def get_node(self, key): -> 2032 return _genapi.NodeMap_get_node(self, key) 2033
LogicalErrorException: Node not existing
The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-10-e1afb14284fb> in <module> ----> 1 ia.start_acquisition()
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/harvesters/core.py in start_acquisition(self, run_in_background) 2426 # We're ready to start image acquisition. Lock the device's 2427 # transport layer related features: -> 2428 self.remote_device.node_map.TLParamsLocked.value = 1 2429 except GenericException: 2430 # SFNC < 2.0
~/anaconda3/envs/genicam/lib/python3.6/site-packages/genicam/genapi.py in __getattr__(self, attribute) 2082 # Raise AttributeError to naturally work with 2083 # the hasattr function: -> 2084 raise AttributeError from e 2085 2086 def __setattr__(self, attribute, val):
AttributeError: </denchmark-code>
can confirm that I get same error on a python script with same code: rom harvesters.core import Harvester <denchmark-code> import numpy as np # This is just for a demonstration.
h = Harvester()
h.add_file('/opt/mvIMPACT_Acquire/lib/x86_64/mvGenTLProducer.cti') h.update()
print(h.files)
#len(h.device_info_list) #h.device_info_list[0]
ia = h.create_image_acquirer(0) ia.remote_device.node_map.Width.value = 8 ia.remote_device.node_map.Height.value = 8 #ia.remote_device.node_map.PixelFormat.value = 'Mono8' ia.remote_device.node_map.PixelFormat.value = 'BayerRG8'
ia.start_acquisition()
with ia.fetch_buffer() as buffer: # Let's create an alias of the 2D image component: component = buffer.payload.components[0]
# Note that the number of components can be vary. If your # target remote device transmits a multi-part information, then # you'd get two or more components in the payload. However, now # we're working with a remote device that transmits only a 2D image. # So we manipulate only index 0 of the list object, components.
# Let's see the acquired data in 1D: _1d = component.data print('1D: {0}'.format(_1d))
# Release and exit ia.stop_acquisition()
quit
</denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rnamdos>@rnamdos</denchmark-link> Hi. The following line is telling me that you are not running the HEAD version: <denchmark-code>2429 except GenericException: </denchmark-code>
It must be: <denchmark-code>2429 except (GenericException, AttributeError): </denchmark-code>

Thank for the prompt reply. Can you elaborate on that? I just checked the hash and it matches the latest development update <denchmark-code>cat .git/refs/heads/master a8c292cea0bf41fe07ab185b719ef58f26c40564
</denchmark-code>

it matches the latest development update
Yes, it matches but the code you have shown is different from the one you have cloned. Could you compare the cloned one and the installed one, please?
I see, this is strange to me. When I use setup.py in the genicam environment, it fails to update to the newly cloned version. But if I do it in the base environment its fine.
I had to uninstall and install the clone. No errors. thank you so much for your time. Excited to start working on openCV now.
